<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Hundred-Moth Caress](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1061)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 185 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 475 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Scythe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=39)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The handles of this _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [scythe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=39)_ are made from a dull, gray wood of bone-like consistency, and when you slice with it, a fluttering gust of hundreds of moths' wingbeats fills the air. If you're a devotee of [Urgathoa](/Deities.aspx?ID=19), you can use this scythe as a divine focus, and with every Strike, it exudes a pallid cloud of powdery dust.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> command ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118)) **Frequency** once per round;   **Effect** You deal 1d10 negative damage to yourself. If your next action is to Strike with the scythe or to Cast a Spell with the [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) or negative trait, that Strike or spell deals additional negative damage equal to the damage you took (after any reductions or increases from immunity, resistances, weaknesses).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Hundred-Moth Caress
